thread.title: Glasgow to Birmingham flight makes emergency landing
thread.title_full: Glasgow to Birmingham flight makes emergency landing

title: Glasgow to Birmingham flight makes emergency landing
text: comments A Flybe plane holding up to 78 passengers and crew was forced to make an emergency landing today after one of its engines failed mid-flight. John MacInnes posted a photo of the moment he realised the propeller had stopped on the 9am service from Glasgow to Birmingham. As it was forced to turn back to the Scottish city he tweeted: 'Oh s***. Number one engine has failed and weâ€™re returning to Glasgow for an emergency landing.' But thanks to the two hero pilots on board the Bombardier Dash 8 jet safely landed a few minutes later. Shocking: This is the moment John MacInnes noticed the plane's stopped mid-flight on the 9am service from Glasgow to Birmingham and was forced to turn back to the Scottish city Commentary: Mr MacInnes also wrote: 'Oh s***. Number one engine has failed' Men of the moment: These are the two Flybe pilots who safely brought the plane and its passengers back to earth Mr MacInnes then tweeted of the plane just after landing with a huge number of fire engines waiting next to the runway. He also posted an image of the 'two amazing pilots' who landed the Flybe plane and said: 'Down safe n' sound thanks to the professionalism of our pilots'. RELATED ARTICLES
